item.title: Kristen add a quote by William Allen White
item.description: "I am not afraid of tomorrow for I have seen yesterday and I love today" -- William Allen White

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Plato
item.description: "Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination and life to everything." -- Plato

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Kristen add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "To acquire the habit of reading is to construct for yourself a refuge from almost all the miseries of life." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "What is that you express in your eyes? It seems to me more than all the print I have read in my life." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: Kristen add a quote by W.B. Yeats
item.description: "It is so many years before one can believe enough in what one feels even to know what the feeling is" -- W.B. Yeats

item.title: Kristen add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced." -- James Baldwin

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Dinah Maria Mulock Craik
item.description: "Oh, the comfort — the inexpressible comfort of feeling <i>safe</i> with a person — having neither to weigh thoughts nor measure words, but pouring them all right out, just as they are, chaff and grain together; certain that a faithful hand will take and sift them, keep what is worth keeping, and then with the breath of kindness blow the rest away." -- Dinah Maria Mulock Craik

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Anybody can become angry — that is easy, but to be angry with the right person and to the right degree and at the right time and for the right purpose, and in the right way — that is not within everybody's power and is not easy." -- Aristotle

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Anne Sexton
item.description: "As it has been said: Love and a cough cannot be concealed. Even a small cough. Even a small love." -- Anne Sexton

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "A wonderful fact to reflect upon, that every human creature is constituted to be that profound secret and mystery to every other." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Kristen add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought; and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Hope Smiles from the threshold of the year to come, Whispering 'it will be happier'..." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Leonard Cohen
item.description: "There is a crack in everything. That's how the light gets in." -- Leonard Cohen

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "Time is the longest distance between two places." -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Kristen add a quote by William Golding
item.description: "My yesterdays walk with me. They keep step, they are gray faces that peer over my shoulder." -- William Golding

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Ellen Bass
item.description: "to love life, to love it even when you have no stomach for it and everything you've held dear crumbles like burnt paper in your hands, your throat filled with the silt of it. When grief sits with you, its tropical heat thickening the air, heavy as water more fit for gills than lungs; when grief weights you like your own flesh only more of it, an obesity of grief, you think, How can a body withstand this? Then you hold life like a face between your palms, a plain face, no charming smile, no violet eyes, and you say, yes, I will take you I will love you, again." -- Ellen Bass

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Marisha Pessl
item.description:
"Happiness is a hound dog in the sun. We aren't on Earth to be happy, but to experience incredible things.
- Hannah Schneider" -- Marisha Pessl

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Now there is a final reason I think that Jesus says, "Love your enemies." It is this: that love has within it a redemptive power. And there is a power there that eventually transforms individuals. Just keep being friendly to that person. Just keep loving them, and they can’t stand it too long. Oh, they react in many ways in the beginning. They react with guilt feelings, and sometimes they’ll hate you a little more at that transition period, but just keep loving them. And by the power of your love they will break down under the load. That’s love, you see. It is redemptive, and this is why Jesus says love. There’s something about love that builds up and is creative. There is something about hate that tears down and is destructive. So love your enemies. (from "Loving Your Enemies")" -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Kristen add a quote by Brené Brown
item.description: "Our stories are not meant for everyone. Hearing them is a privilege, and we should always ask ourselves this before we share: "Who has earned the right to hear my story?" If we have one or two people in our lives who can sit with us and hold space for our shame stories, and love us for our strengths and struggles, we are incredibly lucky. If we have a friend, or small group of friends, or family who embraces our imperfections, vulnerabilities, and power, and fills us with a sense of belonging, we are incredibly lucky." -- Brené Brown
